STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 23, 2023
Jolyne Baarck
FAMILY YOUTH INTERVENTIONS
418 CASS AVE,
MOUNT CLEMENS, MI, 48043-2123
Re: License #: CI500201123
Dear Jolyne Baarck:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
03/08/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Thomasc7@michigan.gov
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4132 Grievance procedures
(1) An agency shall have and follow a written grievance
handling procedure for residents and their families. All of
the following apply:
(a) The policy shall be provided to residents, their
families, and referring sources prior to or at admission.
2

One of one file reviewed, failed to document that a copy of the grievance policy
was provided to youth, family members, and referring source prior to or at
admission.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was not in need of any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency was not offered any consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
During the 2022 renewal, the agency was found to be in non-compliance in the
area of discharge planning and employee records. An approved CAP was
submitted, and the agency completed the tasks to achieve compliance.
Financial Overview
An overview of the financial documents, including annual financial audit, was
completed. No concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
assessment documented that compliance had been achieved as a result of the one
CAP that was required during the renewal assessment in March 2022. Appropriate
adjustments were made in the areas of discharge planning and employee records.
No areas of concern were noted. The assessment also indicated an appropriate
plan for continued monitoring of compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff and one administrator were interviewed during the assessment. No
concerns were noted, and the employees provided positive feedback regarding the
company and its services in the community.
3

The facility currently has placement of one youth in the program. The youth was
offsite at the time of the unannounced visit for the audit. A telephone interview
was completed. Youth was interviewed and expressed feeling safe and well-
adjusted in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through was completed. The agency was found to be well maintained and
appropriately staffed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
03/23/2023
______________________________________________________
Cassandra Thomas Date
Licensing Consultant
